ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Invis: who cares, Regain focus.
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Not anymore!  Now that they have increased the radius on it, this song ROCKS!  For 2 weeks straight I did nightly comando raids into Paw for the Kisch.
ygData.messageBody:
> I never play clouding when going to live tower, just because it's
> too hard to keep 5 other people close enough for invis, I just
> let the invis casters get to work. I would do the same with
> an Invis to Undead song as well... hardly ever use it.
>
> Our invis song is primarily for self use or stationary party
> protection from trains. I don't mind if Clouding gets an undead
> invis component, but do not suggest another song be Invis V Undead.
>

Not anymore! Now that they have increased the radius on it, this song
ROCKS! For 2 weeks straight I did nightly comando raids into Paw for the
Kisch. Each time, my group of 6 got to the Tesch by using my invisi song,
killed him and then invisi'ed around to all the other named spawns and
killed them too. It worked fantastic. No worries about someone's invisi
dropping at the wrong time and with the see invisi component, this song is
actually useful now! Especially in Paw where there isn't a darn thing in
the whole place that can see invisi. The only time we ever had a problem
keeping all 6 of us within the range of the songs effects were when someone
fell off the bridge.... and in those cases, we all just jumped off the
bridge and modified the order in which we took out the spawns that night...
My guild now looks at this song as one of those definative songs of the bard
class. Something that no other class can do... reliable group invisi that
pretty much is guaranteed to never fail.

I'd LOVE to have an undead version of this song for places like Lower Guk.
It would sure as heck make life easier. As it is now, we all carry around 2
or 3 shaman potions in case Invisi to undead starts to drop early....

Taneran
